name: App.net
description: One account. Many applications. Get instant access to hundreds of great social apps on iPhone, iPad, Android and more.

doc.t: The user id. If the user id is me the current authenticated user will be used. You can also specify @username as a user_id.
https://api.app.net/users/me
https://api.app.net/users/:user_id/avatar
The user id to be followed. You can also specify @username as a user_id.
The user id to stop following. You can also specify @username as a user_id.
The id of the User to mute. You can also specify @username as a user_id.
The id of the User to mute. You can also specify @username as a user_id.
The id of the User to block. You can also specify @username as a user_id.
The id of the User to block. You can also specify @username as a user_id.
A comma separated list of User ids to retrieve.
The search query. Supports @username or #tag searches as well as normal search terms. Searches username, display name, bio information. Does not search posts.
(Optional) The number of Users to return, up to a maximum of 200. Defaults to 20 if not specified.
A comma separated list of User ids to retrieve muted User ids for.
A comma separated list of User ids to retrieve blocked User ids for.
The raw text of the post.
(Optional) The id of the Post that this new Post is replying to.

resources.curl:
curl -X POST -H "Authorization: Bearer <YOUR ACCESS TOKEN>" -H "X-ADN-Pretty-JSON: 1" \
    -H "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded" -d "text=If you're in San Francisco on Saturday October 20 and Sunday October 21 come to the first #adnhack => http://appnet.eventbrite.com/" \
    "https://api.app.net/posts"

doc.t: The id of the Post to retrieve.
The id of the Post to delete.
The id of the Post to repost.
The id of the Post to unrepost.
The id of the Post to star.
The id of the Post to unstar.
A comma separated list of ids of Posts to retrieve.
The user id. If the user id is me the current authenticated user will be used. You can also specify @username as a user_id.
https://api.app.net/users/:user_id/posts
The id of the Post to report.
Optional
Optional
https://api.app.net/channels/:channel_id
The id of the Channel to retrieve.
A comma separated list of ids of Channels to retrieve.
https://api.app.net/users/me/channels/pm/num_unread
https://api.app.net/users/me/channels/broadcast/num_unread
https://api.app.net/users/me/channels/broadcast/num_unread
The id of the Channel to update.
The id of the Channel to delete.
The id of the Channel to subscribe to.
The id of the Channel to unsubscribe from.
The id of the Channel to retrieve subscribers for.
The id of the Channel to retrieve subscriber ids for.
A comma separated list of Channel ids to retrieve subscriber ids for.
The id of the Channel to mute.
The id of the Channel to unmute.
Optional
The id of the Channel to retrieve Messages from.
The id of the Channel in which to create the Message. Alternatively, you can specify pm to auto-create/reuse a net.app.core.pm private message channel.
The id of the Channel containing the Message.
The id of the Message to retrieve.
A comma separated list of ids of the Messages to retrieve.
The id of the Channel this Message belongs to.
The id of the Message to delete.
Optional
Optional
https://api.app.net/files/:file_id
The id of the File to retrieve.
A comma separated list of File ids to retrieve.
The id of the File to delete.
The id of the File to update.
The id of the File to retrieve content for.

resources.curl:
curl -X PUT -H "Authorization: Bearer <YOUR ACCESS TOKEN>" -H "Content-Type: image/png" \
    --data-binary "@filename.png" "https://api.app.net/files/1/content"

doc.t: The id of the File to set content for.

resources.curl:
curl -X PUT -H "Authorization: Bearer <YOUR ACCESS TOKEN>" -H "Content-Type: image/png" \
    --data-binary "@filename.png" "https://api.app.net/files/1/content"

doc.t: The id of the File to set content for.
The key identifying the derived file you want to create.

resources.curl:
curl -X PUT -H "Authorization: Bearer <YOUR ACCESS TOKEN>" -H "Content-Type: image/png" \
    --data-binary "@filename.png" "https://api.app.net/files/1/content/thumbnail_png"

doc.t: The connection id of the User Stream to delete.
The connection id of the User Stream the subscription belongs to.
The subscription id of the subscription to cancel
https://api.app.net/filters/:filter_id
The id of the Filter to retrieve.
The id of the Filter to update.
The id of the Filter to delete.
The raw text to process.
https://api.app.net/apps/me/tokens
The Factual id of the Place to retrieve.
https://api.app.net/posts/stream/explore/:slug
The slug of the Explore Stream to retrieve.
